comments.body: Yes. Otherwise it renders `org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord` but we only want to have the short `ConsumerRecord`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +79,83 @@ *

If it is triggered while processing a record streamed from the source processor, * timestamp is defined as the timestamp of the current input record; the timestamp is extracted from * {@link org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.ConsumerRecord ConsumerRecord} by {@link TimestampExtractor}. * Note, that an upstream {@link Processor} might have set a new timestamp by calling * {@link ProcessorContext#forward(Object, Object, To) forward(..., To.all().withTimestamp(...))}.
